title: Files FBI has pertaining to Thomas Joseph Steed date of birth 11/08/1991 of montgomery ny 12549 from 11/08/1991 to current date.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Files FBI has pertaining to Thomas Joseph Steed date of birth 11/08/1991 of montgomery ny 12549 from 11/08/1991 to current date.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Files the FBI has pertaining to Thomas Joseph Steed date of birth 11/08/1991 of Montgomery New York 12549 from 11/08/1991 to current date. 
Including all police reports, dates of contact with FBI, reasons for contact and records FBI has of this individual. 
The individual Thomas Joseph Steed gives any consent required for the release of any and all of the information the FBI may have of Thomas Joseph Steed to the requester of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymouse

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Carrier Certification System Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request a bulk data extract from the NYSDOT Carrier Certification System (carcert.dot.ny.gov), maintained by the Office of Modal Safety & Security, including:

All fields maintained for each certified carrier: certification details, fleet vehicle inventory (count, type, make, model, year), insurance information on file, inspection history, and compliance status
For all currently certified and previously certified carriers (active, suspended, revoked, and expired)
I request this data in electronic format (CSV, pipe-delimited text, or database export). I understand that certain fields may contain personally identifiable information (driver records, Article 19-A records) -- I am not requesting those fields. I am requesting carrier-level organizational and fleet data only.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NY DOT: Individual Inspection Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request individual-level inspection records for all inspections conducted by NYSDOT's Passenger Carrier Safety Bureau and Motor Carrier Compliance Bureau for the past 5 years (2021-2026), including:

Inspection date
Operator / carrier name and Operator ID
Vehicle identification (VIN, plate number, vehicle type)
Inspection location (facility, roadside, or terminal)
Inspection result (pass / fail)
Deficiencies found (if any) with category and description
Out-of-service orders issued (if any)
Inspector ID or facility ID
Re-inspection date and result (if applicable)

I understand this is a large dataset. I am requesting a structured database export in CSV or pipe-delimited format. If the full 5-year span is too large for a single response, I am willing to receive the data in annual increments.

Note: I am aware that aggregated versions of this data are published via the OSIPD API and BUSNET dataset on data.ny.gov. I am specifically requesting the underlying individual inspection records that feed those aggregations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Truck/Freight Carrier Operator Profiles
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

NYSDOT's Truck & Motor Carrier Safety website states that truck and freight carrier operator profiles are "available by written request." I am requesting a bulk dataset of all truck/freight carrier operator profiles maintained by NYSDOT's Office of Modal Safety & Security, Truck & Motor Carrier Safety division, including:

Carrier / operator name
NYSDOT registration or permit number
Business address
USDOT number (if on file)
Number of vehicles
Vehicle types operated
Operating authority type (intrastate, for-hire, private, etc.)
Registration status (active, expired, suspended)
Registration effective and expiration dates
Any safety ratings or compliance status
I request this data in electronic format (CSV or pipe-delimited text file).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Enforcement Actions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request records of all enforcement actions taken by NYSDOT's Office of Modal Safety & Security (Passenger Carrier Safety Bureau, Truck & Motor Carrier Safety, and Motor Carrier Compliance Bureau) against certified passenger carriers and registered motor carriers for the past 10 years, including:

Carrier name and Operator ID / Certification number
Action type (suspension, revocation, fine, warning, consent order, cease and desist)
Action date
Effective date and duration (if temporary suspension)
Reason / basis for action (violation description or citation)
Resolution (if resolved -- reinstatement date, fine paid, etc.)
Current status of the action (active, resolved, appealed)

I request this data in electronic format (CSV or pipe-delimited text). If enforcement records are maintained in a database, I am requesting a structured export rather than copies of individual documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYDOT: Certified Passenger Carrier List
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records maintained by the NYSDOT Office of Modal Safety & Security, Passenger Carrier Safety Bureau:

A list of all passenger carriers currently certified or previously certified by NYSDOT, including the following fields for each carrier:

Carrier name (legal name and DBA if different)
NYSDOT Operator ID / Certification number
Certification type (school bus, motorcoach, ambulette, for-hire passenger, charter, etc.)
Certification status (active, suspended, revoked, expired, pending)
Certification effective date
Certification expiration date (if applicable)
Suspension or revocation date and reason (if applicable)
Business address (street, city, state, zip)
County
NYSDOT region
USDOT number (if on file)
Number of vehicles authorized

I request this data in electronic format, preferably as a CSV or pipe-delimited text file. If the full dataset is too large for email delivery, I am willing to receive it via a file-sharing link or on physical media.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the specific statutory basis for the denial and release the remaining non-exempt portions.

I am willing to discuss narrowing the scope of this request if it is deemed unreasonably burdensome. Please contact me at [email/phone] to discuss.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White
